result.execSummary:
The defendant Virgil L Julius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Def to comply w/ Sex Offender Registry w/in 1st 100 days of probation.  Sex Offender Registry Required.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 8/26/14: Crt orders 3 mo conditional jail time or until halfway house placement as a condition of an ATR agreement for rule violation to commence date of signature (8/26/14).

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Sex Offender Registry Required. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter: Linda Flakne
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

- Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $1000.00 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case. If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Joshua M. Bowland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Def is terminated from BMP & will be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
 - Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 15

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
